abstract: Not an argument for a Latvian solution.
snippet: Not an argument for a Latvian solution.
lead_paragraph: Iceland's condition can at best be described as "not as bad as it could have been." I'm getting a lot of correspondence, in particular, about the problem of household debt. During the boom Icelandic citizens borrowed quite a lot, often with loans that were either euro-denominated or indexed to inflation. With the krona depreciated and real wages lower thanks to higher import prices, this leaves a lot of people in debt distress.
